note.p: Career: Head , Correspondence Department (1797-1806), then Secretary, Transport Board (1806-1815); Chief Secretary, New South Wales Colony (1825); went to Australia (1826) Member of Executive and Legislative Councils and of the Land Board; first President, Australian Museum; first Speaker, Legislative Council (1843-1846); accumulated the largest entomological collection in Australia; MacLeay River and MacLeay Range, New South Wales, named after him
